author: Lauren Dezenski, Joe Mathieu
description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro sought to raise pressure on India to halt purchases of Russian energy after the US imposed crippling new tariffs on New Delhi, casting the conflict in Ukraine as “Modi’s war.”
title: Navarro Calls Ukraine ‘Modi’s War,’ Hits India Over Russian Oil

author: Andrea Palasciano, Slav Okov
description: NATO members are on track to spend more than $1.5 trillion on defense in 2025, according to the alliance’s latest estimates, as they build up their militaries amid geopolitical tensions and pressure from the US.
title: NATO Allies Set to Spend Over $1.5 Trillion on Defense This Year

author: Silla Brush
description: BlackRock Inc. warned that public pensions are at risk from Democrats and Republicans pressing asset managers to heed their political demands over how retirement funds are invested.
title: BlackRock Warns Public Pensions Are Becoming Too Politicized

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: A powerful Thai court will decide the fate of yet another prime minister on Friday, potentially forcing out the fifth elected leader since 2008 and deepening the country’s political drift.
title: Powerful Thai Court Again to Decide Fate of Thaksin-Aligned Prime Minister

author: Nicolle Yapur, Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Argentine authorities said they successfully rolled over a large batch of local debt on Wednesday, passing a key test for Javier Milei’s strategy to contain a slide in the peso ahead of mid-term elections.
title: Argentina Rolls Over Debt in Relief for Battered Currency

author: Clarice Couto
description: Brazil moved closer to obtaining approval to export beef to Mexico from more plants as Latin America’s biggest economy seeks new markets after being hit by US tariffs.
title: Tariffs-Hit Brazil Seeks Mexico Consent for More Beef Plants

author: Robert Tuttle
description: Alberta plans to impose a 2% levy on the computer hardware on large data centers starting at the end of next year.
title: Alberta to Impose 2% Levy on Computer Hardware at Data Centers

author: Eric Martin
description: The Mexican government plans to increase tariffs on China as part of its 2026 budget proposal next month, protecting the nation’s businesses from cheap imports and satisfying a longstanding demand of US President Donald Trump.
title: Mexico Set to Raise Tariffs on Imports From China After US Push

author: Madison Muller, Josh Eidelson
description: US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Director Susan Monarez is being ousted just weeks into her tenure, according to people familiar with the matter who weren’t authorized to speak publicly, adding instability to the Trump administration’s public health policy.
title: CDC Director Susan Monarez Has Been Ousted Weeks Into Tenure

author: Ari Natter
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, energy policy reporter Ari Natter looks at the politics of power prices. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Rising Electricity Bills May Spell Trouble for GOP in Elections

author: Alicia Clanton
description: A top Republican lawmaker in California has presented a longshot resolution to split the state in two as a response to Governor Gavin Newsom’s plan to redraw its congressional maps to favor Democrats.
title: Republican Angered by Newsom’s Maps Wants to Break Up California

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US rejected a United Nations-backed report that declared a famine in Gaza, breaking with other members of the UN Security Council as it denied that Israel was engaged in a “policy of starvation” in the enclave as part of the war with Hamas.
title: US Rejects UN-Backed Report’s Finding of Famine in Gaza Strip

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Argentine President Javier Milei escaped unscathed after being attacked with stones while campaigning in the province of Buenos Aires.
title: Milei Unhurt After Being Pelted With Stones While Campaigning

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy appointed former Prime Minister Olha Stefanishyna the country’s new ambassador to the US almost a year after members of Donald Trump’s administration demanded he remove a longtime envoy.
title: Zelenskiy Replaces Ambassador to US in Belated Gesture to Trump

author: William Horobin
description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou will meet with opposition parties starting Monday as he struggles to avoid losing a confidence vote early next month.
title: France’s Bayrou to Meet With Opposition Parties Ahead of Confidence Vote

author: Foster Wong
description: China’s former central bank chief Zhou Xiaochuan issued a warning about the potential dangers of stablecoins, putting him in opposition to growing calls by policy advisers and economists for China to consider their use.
title: Former PBOC Chief Zhou Pushes Back Against China Stablecoin Idea

author: Eric Martin, Jonathan Tirone
description: Satellite imagery shows no evidence that near-bomb grade uranium has been moved from Iran’s Isfahan site since a US attack two months ago, said the UN’s International Atomic Energy Agency, while calling on Tehran to fulfill its legal obligations to allow monitoring to resume.
title: No Evidence Iran Nuclear Material Has Moved, UN Watchdog Says

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union is mulling introducing secondary sanctions in an effort to prevent third countries from helping Russia circumvent the bloc’s existing punitive measures against Moscow, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Considers Secondary Sanctions to Hit Russia’s War Effort

author: Gerry Smith, Damian Garde
description: US regulators have approved updated versions of the Covid vaccine, though a much smaller group of people will be eligible to receive them this fall.
title: US Approves Latest Covid Shots With Limits on Who Gets Them

author: Firat Kozok
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan unveiled a $1.5 billion research and development facility for state-run defense contractor Aselsan Elektronik Sanayi Ve Ticaret AS, the latest major investment aimed at growing the defense industry.
title: Turkey Unveils $1.5 Billion Research Base in Boost to Defense

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump said that philanthropist George Soros and his son should be charged with racketeering for allegedly supporting violent protests “and much more,” without citing any evidence.
title: Trump Says Soros Should Be Charged Over ‘Violent Protests’

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof and his cabinet survived a no-confidence vote, easing concerns about a complete collapse of the country’s caretaker government.
title: Dutch Crisis Eases as Caretaker Premier Wins Confidence Vote

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump’s top economic adviser said that Lisa Cook should go on leave while her status on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors is being litigated.
title: Fed’s Cook Should Go on Leave While Case Plays Out, Hassett Says

author: Swati Gupta, Ruchi Bhatia
description: President Donald Trump’s move to penalize India for buying oil from Russia will increase economic risks for the South Asian nation and test its longstanding ties with Moscow.
title: What’s at Stake as Trump Tests India’s Ties With Russia

author: Jan Bratanic, Patrick Donahue
description: Slovenia’s top diplomat warned the European Union risked projecting a double standard if it failed to take Israel to task for the bloodshed in the Gaza Strip even as it moves ahead with additional sanctions against Russia.
title: Slovenia Urges EU Address Uneven Response to Israel, Russia

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Giorgia Meloni vowed to relaunch a proposed change to how Italian prime ministers are chosen even though a previous reform push appeared to receive tepid popular support.
title: Meloni Seeks Reform to Let Italians Directly Choose Premiers

author: Nicolle Yapur, Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: President Javier Milei is ratcheting up his defense of Argentina’s currency ahead of another massive local debt auction, piling the pain on the banking system and the broader economy as he fights inflation.
title: Milei Digs In to Defend Argentine Peso Before Midterm Elections

author: Iain Rogers
description: Germany and France have agreed to delay a decision on the future of the troubled FCAS fighter jet program until the end of the year, according to Chancellor Friedrich Merz, leaving one of Europe’s most ambitious weapons projects mired in uncertainty.
title: Germany and France Postpone FCAS Fighter Decision to End of Year

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent repeated his call for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell to conduct an internal review of the central bank, and referred to mortgage-fraud allegations about Fed board member Lisa Cook as the type of thing that should be included.
title: Bessent Repeats Call for Fed Review After Cook Fraud Allegations

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: President Donald Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff will meet a Ukrainian delegation to the US this week as Kyiv’s allies discuss possible security guarantees for the war-ravaged nation, a person familiar with the plans said.
title: Zelenskiy Sending Top Envoys to US for Witkoff Talks This Week

author: Julian Lee
description: Shipments have fallen by 600,000 barrels a day over the past two weeks
title: Russian Crude Exports Slide on Drone Strikes and Trump's Tariffs

author: Ari Natter, Naureen S Malik
description: Surging utility bills in key battleground states are threatening to become a political liability for Republicans heading into upcoming elections.
title: Soaring Power Bills in Largest US Grid Pose Risk for Republicans

author: Lee J Miller, Anuchit Nguyen
description: Thailand and Cambodia should urgently resolve their simmering border conflict to minimize hit to businesses and tourism, according to Minor International Pcl, one of Asia’s largest hospitality groups.
title: Hotel Tycoon Calls for Urgent End to Thai-Cambodia Border Spat

author: Alexander Parker
description: South Africans are experiencing a surge in fraud, a new survey showed, the latest indicator that the authorities are struggling to bring crime under control.
title: South Africans Confront 54% Fraud Surge as Crime Control Falters

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan’s top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa will visit the US this week to press Washington to implement lower the tariffs agreed in July including lower duties on cars and auto parts.
title: Japan’s Akazawa to Visit US, Push for Start of Lower Car Tariffs

author: Sri Taylor
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is moving to reclaim management of Washington’s Union Station, a historic rail hub that federal officials say has deteriorated after decades of fractured oversight.
title: Trump Administration to Reclaim Control of DC’s Union Station

author: Ian King
description: Many analysts have no idea how much revenue Nvidia will report from China in its earnings due later today.
title: The US-China Rivalry on AI Runs Through Nvidia

author: Suzanne Lynch, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union will seek to fast track legislation by the end of the week to remove all tariffs on US industrial goods, a demand made by President Donald Trump before the US will lower its duties on the bloc’s automobile exports.
title: EU to Propose Removing US Tariffs This Week to Meet Trump Demand

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon is preparing for its in-house DOGE team to examine almost half a million contracts and grants in a bid to trim waste.
title: Pentagon’s DOGE Unit to Scrutinize 400,000 Contracts for Cuts

author: Colum Murphy
description: China said President Donald Trump welcoming a large number of students to the US was better than American officials bothering them at the border — a barb delivered as the nations resume talks aimed at addressing their differences.
title: China Says Trump’s Student Welcome Preferable to Harassment

author: Christian Wienberg, Sanne Wass
description: Denmark’s foreign minister summoned a US diplomat in the Nordic country for talks after a media report suggested American interference in Greenland.
title: Denmark Summons US Diplomat Over Alleged Greenland Influencing

author: Chandra Asmara, Eddie Spence
description: Indonesian sovereign wealth fund Danantara has signed a $1.42 billion heads of agreement with Chinese company GEM Co. Ltd. to develop a plant producing battery-grade nickel.
title: Danantara and GEM to Develop $1.4 Billion Indonesia Nickel Plant

author: Brian Platt
description: Canadian Energy Minister Tim Hodgson said his government is taking steps toward exporting natural gas to Europe, and criticized former Prime Minister Justin Trudeau for not making the same effort.
title: Carney’s Energy Minister Rebukes Trudeau Over LNG Policy in Europe

author: Laura Alviz
description: Rheinmetall AG is opening what will be Europe’s biggest ammunition factory after a slight delay as discussions about security guarantees for Ukraine gather steam and Germany sets out to massively expand its military.
title: Rheinmetall Opens Europe’s Largest Artillery Ammunition Factory

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Antonio Vanuzzo
description: The Italian government is seeking to tap bank profits again as a way to prop up its public finances, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Italy Said to Weigh New €1.5 Billion Bank Tax to Bolster Budget

author: Alice Gledhill, Julien Ponthus
description: French assets steadied in early trading on Wednesday, bringing some respite ahead of a key vote next month that could trigger a collapse in the government.
title: French Markets Stabilize After Selloff as Political Vote Looms

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof and his cabinet face a parliamentary showdown on Wednesday that could lead them to step down, plunging the country into an unprecedented political crisis.
title: Dutch Political Crisis Deepens as Cabinet Faces Potential Exit

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s cabinet will approve a draft law Wednesday designed to boost recruitment into the armed forces, part of its response to new security risks following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Merz Launches Bid to Lure More Recruits Into German Armed Forces

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan named a new economic minister as Lai Ching-te’s cabinet gets the first shake-up of his presidency following several political setbacks.
title: Taiwan Revamps Cabinet Following Lai’s Political Setbacks

author: Faseeh Mangi, Tooba Khan
description: America’s seniormost envoy in Pakistan has told the South Asian nation that US companies are showing “strong interest” in its oil and gas sector, after President Donald Trump late last month surprised the industry by vaunting “massive” reserves.
title: US Firms Said to Eye Pakistan Oil After Trump’s Reserves Claim

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK’s minister for EU relations will argue that Nigel Farage would undo recent progress with Brussels, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to blunt the rise of the Brexit campaigner’s upstart political party.
title: Starmer Minister to Warn Farage Would Take Europe Ties Backward

author: Samy Adghirni, Andra Timu
description: Germany, France and Poland are set to bolster Moldova’s leadership amid mounting concerns among European officials that next month’s parliamentary elections might produce a strong result for pro-Russian parties, hindering the eastern European nation’s efforts to pivot to the West.
title: Merz and Macron to Offer Moldova Support to Deter Moscow Threat

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India’s top air commander has advised caution about an ongoing military overhaul that is the largest in seven decades, in a show of skepticism over a plan Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government is embracing.
title: India’s Air Force Chief Questions Modi’s Military Overhaul Push

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea lambasted South Korean President Lee Jae Myung after he urged efforts to denuclearize the Korean Peninsula during a visit to the US for talks with President Donald Trump, calling the idea a “naive dream.”
title: North Korea Slams South Korea Leader Lee Over Nuclear ‘Paranoia’
